topic: Dual Coding Works. ‘Learning Styles’ Don’t: What to Actually Do with Visuals
target_audience: teachers, curriculum designers, and students creating study materials

refs.content: No credible evidence for the 'meshing hypothesis'; tailoring instruction to learning styles lacks support.
Dual Coding Theory: combining verbal + nonverbal representations supports learning when visuals map core ideas.
Practical dual coding strategies (diagrams, timelines, graphic organizers) to pair with text.

special_instructions: Debunk learning-styles neatly; then give actionable dual-coding templates and examples that avoid decorative images.
